topics.title: Refuse Boarding for Trespassers
topics.description: Policy to refuse boarding on trains for individuals caught trespassing at grade crossings. This enforcement measure creates a direct consequence for unauthorized crossing behavior.
topics.advantages: - Creates direct deterrent effect\n- Provides enforcement mechanism\n- Can be implemented with existing transit infrastructure
topics.drawbacks: - Requires coordination with transit agencies\n- May not address root causes of trespassing\n- Enforcement challenges and resource requirements

topics.title: Anti-Trespass Panels
topics.description: Panels installed along railroad tracks to prevent unauthorized access and crossing. These barriers create a physical deterrent to trespassing behavior.
topics.advantages: - Physical deterrent to unauthorized access\n- Visible barrier that clearly marks restricted areas\n- Can be customized for specific site conditions
topics.drawbacks: - Ongoing maintenance requirements\n- May not prevent determined trespassers\n- Cost of installation and materials

topics.title: Pedestrian-Specific Gate
topics.description: Gate designed specifically for pedestrian use at grade crossings. These gates are tailored to pedestrian movement patterns and can be more effective than vehicle-oriented gates for preventing unauthorized crossings.
topics.advantages: - Tailored to pedestrian needs and movement patterns\n- Can be more effective than vehicle gates for pedestrian safety\n- Allows for appropriate sizing and placement
topics.drawbacks: - Higher cost than standard gates\n- Maintenance requirements\n- May require coordination with rail operations

topics.title: Gate Skirts
topics.description: Additional barriers attached to crossing gates to prevent pedestrians from ducking under or bypassing the gate. These extensions close the gap between the gate arm and the ground.
topics.advantages: - Prevents bypassing gates by ducking under\n- Relatively low cost addition to existing gates\n- Effective visual and physical barrier
topics.drawbacks: - Extra maintenance requirements\n- May impede legitimate use if not properly designed\n- Weather and wear considerations

topics.title: Manual Swing Gates
topics.description: Manually operated gates that swing closed to block pedestrian access to railroad tracks. Users must actively open and close the gate, creating a deliberate action requirement.
topics.advantages: - Simple mechanism with low maintenance\n- Cost-effective solution\n- Creates deliberate action requirement for crossing
topics.drawbacks: - Requires manual operation (may be left open)\n- Dependent on user compliance\n- May not prevent determined trespassers

topics.title: Pedestrian Channelization
topics.description: Physical guidance elements such as fencing, bollards, or landscaping that direct pedestrians to designated crossing points and away from unauthorized crossing locations.
topics.advantages: - Guides users to safer crossing locations\n- Reduces random or unauthorized crossing behavior\n- Can improve overall crossing safety
topics.drawbacks: - May restrict movement and access\n- Requires maintenance of channelization elements\n- Right-of-way and design considerations

topics.title: Automatic Audio Warning
topics.description: Automated audio warning systems that activate when trains approach, providing audible alerts to pedestrians at grade crossings. These systems can include bells, horns, or voice announcements.
topics.advantages: - Provides clear auditory signal of approaching trains\n- Accessible to visually impaired users\n- Can be synchronized with train detection systems
topics.drawbacks: - Noise pollution concerns for nearby residents\n- Potential for false alarms or system failures\n- Requires power and maintenance

topics.title: Hostile Architecture
topics.description: Strategic use of landscape elements such as rock treatments, dense vegetation, or other natural barriers that discourage unauthorized crossing while maintaining aesthetic appeal.
topics.advantages: - Natural deterrent that blends with environment\n- Aesthetically integrated solution\n- Low maintenance once established
topics.drawbacks: - May not be fully effective against determined trespassers\n- Requires ongoing landscape maintenance\n- Environmental and ecological considerations

topics.title: Crossing Alignment Adjustment
topics.description: Modifying the angle and approach of pedestrian and bicycle crossings to meet tracks at approximately 90 degrees, improving visibility and reducing crossing time.
topics.advantages: - Improves visibility of approaching trains\n- Reduces crossing time and exposure\n- Enhances user comfort and safety
topics.drawbacks: - Significant infrastructure changes required\n- Right-of-way and cost impacts\n- May require coordination with multiple stakeholders

topics.title: Flangeway Gap Filler
topics.description: Material or system used to fill the gap between rails and road surface (flangeway) to prevent bicycle wheels, wheelchair wheels, or pedestrian feet from getting caught in the gap.
topics.advantages: - Prevents wheel entrapment accidents\n- Improves accessibility for wheeled users\n- Reduces tripping hazards
topics.drawbacks: - Requires regular maintenance and replacement\n- Must be compatible with rail operations\n- Cost of materials and installation

topics.title: Lower Pedestrian Signs
topics.description: Signage positioned at pedestrian eye level (typically 5-7 feet) rather than vehicle height, making warnings and instructions more visible and readable for pedestrians.
topics.advantages: - Improved visibility and readability for pedestrians\n- More noticeable at appropriate sight lines\n- Can include pedestrian-specific messaging
topics.drawbacks: - Potential for vandalism or damage\n- Requires strategic placement\n- May need additional maintenance

topics.title: Sidewalk Pavement Markings
topics.description: Visual indicators painted or applied to sidewalk surfaces to guide pedestrians, warn of crossing locations, or provide directional cues at grade crossings.
topics.advantages: - Clear visual guidance at ground level\n- Cost-effective solution\n- Can be customized for specific messaging
topics.drawbacks: - Weather-related wear requiring frequent repainting\n- May become less visible over time\n- Surface preparation and maintenance needs

topics.title: Active Warning for Trails/Sidewalks
topics.description: Install **flashing beacons** or integrated warning at sidepath approaches synchronized with train detection.
topics.notablePractices: - Coordinate with rail signal maintainer\n- Provide clear sight triangle\n- Pair with channelization where needed
topics.advantages: - High conspicuity\n- Supports visually-impaired users with audible options
topics.drawbacks: - Higher capital & maintenance cost\n- Requires power & interconnect

topics.title: School Outreach Campaign
topics.description: Develop age-appropriate **education** modules on rail safety for nearby schools.
topics.notablePractices: - Coordinate with district calendar\n- Include near-miss reporting info
topics.drawbacks: - Impact may be diffuse without reinforcement

topics.title: Social Media Outreach Campaign
topics.drawbacks: - Impact may be diffuse without reinforcement
